Description: Head bead. The bead is in the form of a male head of roughly cylindrical form with flattened back. The face is in opaque white glass; the row of curls from ear to ear and the eye brows are of opaque dark-blue glass. The eyes are opaque white discs outlined in dark-blue glass with small dark-blue centres. Disc earrings of opaque yellow glass are worn. The back of the head, suspension loop on top of the head, and the remains of the beard are of opaque turquoise-blue glass. Vertical opening through the bead retaining a red core.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (420)
Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.46)
